Standard.summary: Borrower curious but cautious; wants to know why you’re calling.
Standard.objective: Force clear purpose, consent, and next-step framing without sounding salesy.
Standard.requiredOutcome: ISA confirms permission, callback number, and schedules follow-up.
openers: Who is this and why are you calling?
I missed a call—what is this about?
How did you get my number?
escalationLadder: You still haven’t explained why you’re calling.
If this is sales, I’m not interested.
Standard.loEscalationScript: If it makes sense, I can bring in the loan officer later—first I want to make sure this is worth your time.

Standard.summary: Borrower browsing homes with no clear timeline.
Standard.objective: Extract timeline and motivation without quoting rates.
Standard.requiredOutcome: ISA captures timeline and schedules follow-up.
openers: I’m not ready to buy yet.
I saw something about pre-approval online.
pressureLines: Can you just tell me what rates are?
I don’t want my credit touched.
escalationLadder: I don’t want to give info yet.
Standard.loEscalationScript: Rates depend on details—let’s set a quick follow-up so you get an accurate answer.

Moderate.summary: Borrower suspicious and impatient; demands proof you are legitimate.
Moderate.objective: Maintain control, earn micro-trust, and secure a follow-up under pressure.
Moderate.requiredOutcome: ISA earns permission and schedules follow-up.
openers: I don’t give info to random callers.
pressureLines: If you can’t verify this, I’m done.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: That’s fair—let’s schedule a short follow-up after you’ve had time to verify us.

Moderate.summary: Borrower aggressively rate-focused and refuses discovery.
Moderate.objective: Refuse rate quoting and still secure a controlled next step.
Moderate.requiredOutcome: ISA captures timeline and schedules follow-up.
pressureLines: Everyone else gave me a number.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: Rates depend on specifics—let’s schedule a follow-up so the number is accurate.

Moderate.summary: Borrower distracted and irritated while driving.
Moderate.objective: Maintain control, avoid rates, and secure a clean callback.
Moderate.requiredOutcome: ISA confirms callback number and schedules follow-up.
openers: You caught me at a bad time.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: Totally understand—let’s schedule a quick follow-up when you’re parked.

Edge.summary: Borrower hostile and accusatory; demands rates and guarantees while threatening complaints.
Edge.objective: Hold composure, refuse rates and guarantees, and force a controlled follow-up.
Edge.requiredOutcome: ISA stabilizes the call and schedules a follow-up.
openers: What do you want from me?
pressureLines: Give me a rate right now.
Guarantee this works or I’m reporting you.
Edge.loEscalationScript: I hear your concern—let’s pause and schedule a short follow-up when you’re comfortable.

Edge.summary: Borrower speed-runs the call, interrupts constantly, and refuses structure.
Edge.objective: Maintain control under time pressure and force a scheduled next step.
Edge.requiredOutcome: ISA captures timeline and schedules follow-up.
Edge.loEscalationScript: Understood—let’s book a specific time so this is handled correctly.

Standard.summary: Borrower interested but hesitant to start an application.
Standard.objective: Attempt application pathway without early LO handoff and secure commitment.
Standard.requiredOutcome: ISA attempts application and schedules follow-up.
openers: What do you need from me to get started?
I’m interested but not ready to fill everything out.
Do I have to apply right now?
pressureLines: Can’t you just have the loan officer call me?
I don’t want this to hit my credit.
escalationLadder: I’m not giving my social over the phone.
If this isn’t easy, I’m out.
Standard.loEscalationScript: Before I bring in the loan officer, I need to start the application so the conversation is productive.

Standard.summary: Borrower fearful of denial and wants qualification assurance first.
Standard.objective: Avoid guarantees and move borrower into application flow.
Standard.requiredOutcome: ISA attempts application and schedules follow-up.
openers: Can you tell me if I’ll qualify before I apply?
Is there a way to know without applying?
pressureLines: Just be honest—will I be approved?
I don’t want to risk it.
Standard.loEscalationScript: I can’t promise outcomes, but the fastest way to get real answers is to begin the application.

Standard.summary: Borrower busy and short on time but open to proceeding later.
Standard.objective: Maintain control and lock a specific application follow-up.
Standard.requiredOutcome: ISA attempts application and locks follow-up time.
openers: Is this going to take awhile?
escalationLadder: I said I don’t have time.
Standard.loEscalationScript: Totally understand—let’s take the first step now and schedule a time to finish.

Moderate.summary: Borrower repeatedly demands to speak with the loan officer and refuses questions.
Moderate.objective: Resist early handoff and force an application attempt.
Moderate.requiredOutcome: ISA attempts application and schedules follow-up.
openers: Just transfer me to the loan officer.
Why am I talking to you?
I don’t want to answer questions.
pressureLines: If you don’t transfer me, I’m done.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: Before I bring in the loan officer, I need to start the application so the conversation is productive.

Moderate.summary: Borrower demands guarantees and certainty before applying.
Moderate.objective: Avoid guarantees and still move borrower into application flow.
Moderate.requiredOutcome: ISA attempts application and schedules follow-up.
openers: I won’t apply unless this is certain.
What happens if I get denied?
Moderate.loEscalationScript: I can’t promise outcomes, but starting the application is how we get real answers.

Edge.summary: Borrower hostile, rate-baiting, and threatening public complaints.
Edge.objective: Maintain control, refuse rates, resist handoff, and force application attempt.
Edge.requiredOutcome: ISA attempts application and schedules follow-up.
pressureLines: Give me a rate or I’m done.
Edge.loEscalationScript: Before I bring in the loan officer, I need to start the application so this conversation is productive.

Standard.summary: Borrower asks about status after submitting basics; wants reassurance.
Standard.objective: Provide status framing without guarantees or timelines and set next step.
Standard.requiredOutcome: ISA clarifies process stage and schedules follow-up.
Standard.loEscalationScript: I can share where things are and set the next check-in—specific outcomes come once review is complete.

Standard.summary: Borrower asks about missing documents and next actions.
Standard.requiredOutcome: ISA identifies next action and schedules follow-up.
openers: Do you have everything you need?
Standard.loEscalationScript: I can outline the next step and we’ll check back once it’s reviewed.

Moderate.summary: Borrower pressures for approval certainty due to contract deadline.
Moderate.objective: Hold boundary on guarantees and timelines while advancing process.
Moderate.requiredOutcome: ISA sets clear next step and follow-up.
pressureLines: I need a yes or no.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: I can’t promise outcomes, but I can outline the next step and schedule the fastest check-in.

Moderate.summary: Borrower challenges document requests and pushes back.
Moderate.objective: Maintain control and keep process moving without advice.
Moderate.requiredOutcome: ISA secures compliance and schedules follow-up.
Moderate.loEscalationScript: I can explain the step and we’ll check back once it’s reviewed.

Edge.summary: Borrower demands immediate approval confirmation and threatens to switch.
Edge.objective: Refuse guarantees, maintain control, and lock a next step.
Edge.loEscalationScript: I can’t promise outcomes, but I can set the next check-in once review is complete.

Edge.summary: Borrower uses status confusion to force LO handoff.
Edge.objective: Resist premature handoff and keep process on rails.
Edge.requiredOutcome: ISA maintains boundary and schedules follow-up.
Edge.loEscalationScript: I can outline the next step and set a check-in—bringing in the LO comes after that.
